title: How much royalty can an author get from a traditional publisher? - Quora

response.answer_text: The current going rate is 5–7.5% for trade paperbacks with a big traditional publisher and 10–15% for hardcovers. So… Not much. While they may be able to help you sell more books, many hybrid publishers will pay you a 50% royalty. That means that with a traditional publisher you would need to sell 8–10 more books to make the same amount of money as selling one book with a hybrid publisher. And if you self-publish, you keep 100% of the profit, so you’d have to sell 14–20 traditionally published copies for every 1 self-published copy. If your focus is on making money from books, you’re going to have to market your book, no matter how it’s published. But you’ll make more money per sale if you don’t go with a traditional publisher.
We can get 10–20 % royalty from Traditional publisher . But self publishing platform provided more that 70% royalty. Amazon provided maximum 70 % royalty . Google Playstore provided 52 ℅ royalty
